metadata.title: CVE-2022-48839 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/packet: fix slab-out-of-bounds access in packet_recvmsg()syzbot found that when an AF_PACKET socket is using PACKET_COPY_THRESHand mmap operations, tpacket_rcv() is queueing skbs withgarbage in skb->cb[], triggering a too big copy [1]Presumably, users of af_packet using mmap() already gets correctmetadata from the mapped buffer, we can simply make sureto clear 12 bytes that might be copied to user space later.BUG: KASAN: stack-out-of-bounds in memcpyinclude/linux/fortify-string.h:225 [inline]BUG: KASAN: stack-out-of-bounds in packet_recvmsg+0x56c/0x1150net/packet/af_packet.c:3489Write of size 165 at addr ffffc9000385fb78 by task syz-executor233/3631CPU: 0 PID: 3631 Comm:
